ru.yandex.subtitles.content.dao

Class AbstractReadOnlyDAO<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.yandex.subtitles.content.dao.AbstractReadOnlyDAO<E>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractIdentifyDAO

    public abstract class AbstractReadOnlyDAO<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    Class provides read-only access to any data in content provider. Implementation of object-relation mapping should be provided by child.

      • get

        protected java.util.List<E> get(java.lang.String selection,
                    java.lang.String[] selectionArgs,
                    java.lang.String sortOrder)
        Query the given content uri, returning a non-null List of entities.
        Parameters:
        selection - A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
        selectionArgs - You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
        sortOrder - How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
        Returns:
        a non-null List of data entities.

      • getTableUri

        protected abstract android.net.Uri getTableUri()
        Implement this method to provide content uri.
        Returns:
        a non-null content uri

      • getProjection

        protected abstract java.lang.String[] getProjection()
        Implement this method to provide a list of which columns to return during query.
        Returns:
        a nullable array of column names.

      • getItemFromCursor

        protected abstract E getItemFromCursor(android.database.Cursor cursor)

        Implement this method to provide cursor-to-entity mapping.

        Here is the standard idiom for entity mapping: 

           public class MyDataDAO extends AbstractReadOnlyDAO {

     ...

     protected MyData getItemFromCursor(final Cursor cursor) {
         MyData myData = new MyData();
         myData.setInteger(getInteger(cursor, Columns.INTEGER_COLUMN));
         myData.setString(getString(cursor, Columns.STRING_COLUMN));
         return myData;
     }

   }
        Parameters:
        cursor - cursor
        Returns:
        non-null data entity.
